intro: Cacalia obtusata, commonly known as the bluntleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lobed leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cacalia obtusata is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
